name: Strongid
notes: Roundworms and hookworms ONLY. Very cheap, use preventatively.

conditions.name: Roundworms / Hookworms
conditions.notes: Ballpark is ok, okay to round to closest 0.5ml.

conditions.name: Roundworms / Hookworms
conditions.notes: Ballpark is ok, okay to round to closest 0.5ml.

name: Panacur
notes: Whipworms, hookworms, roundworms, giardia. Bloody diarrhea, vomiting worms.

conditions.name: Parasites / Giardia
conditions.notes: Can be done longer when vet requests. If treating confirmed whips retreat in 3 weeks then 3 months.

conditions.name: Parasites / Giardia
conditions.notes: Can be done longer when vet requests. If treating confirmed whips retreat in 3 weeks then 3 months.

name: Marquis Paste
notes: Shake bottle well, separates.

conditions.name: Coccidia
conditions.notes: Can be done longer when needed.

conditions.name: Coccidia
conditions.notes: Can be done longer when needed.

name: Reglan (Metoclopramide)
notes: DVM Rx Only. Used for parvo, or cats/dogs not eating/vomiting.

name: Cerenia
notes: Very expensive!

conditions.name: Acute Vomiting (Oral)
conditions.notes: Prevention of acute vomiting.

conditions.name: Motion Sickness
conditions.notes: Fast 1 hour before. Give 2 hours before travel. Max 2 days in a row.

name: Ondansetron
notes: Used later in treatment for not eating/vomiting.

name: Gentamicin Drops
notes: Corneal ulcers (stain first), yellow/green discharge.

conditions.name: Conjunctivitis / Ulcers
conditions.notes: Recipe: 15ml mineral oil or artificial tears + Gentamycin 100mg/ml 0.5ml

conditions.name: Conjunctivitis / Ulcers
conditions.notes: Recipe: 15ml mineral oil or artificial tears + Gentamycin 100mg/ml 0.5ml

name: Ciprofloxacin Drops
notes: DVM Rx Only. Infection, inflammation, ulcers (stain first).

name: BNP Ointment
notes: DVM Rx Only. Normally for dogs. Can cause rare reaction in cats.

conditions.name: Eye Infection
conditions.notes: Use with caution in cats.

name: Tramadol
notes: DVM Rx Only. Controlled substance. Post surgery pain.

conditions.name: Pain
conditions.notes: 0-9 lbs: 1/4 tab; 10-20lbs: 1/2 tab; 21-40 lbs: 1 tab; 40-55 lbs: 1.5 tab; 55-75lbs: 2 tab.

name: Tramadol / Tinic
notes: DVM Rx Only! Crush 2 tablets for every 10cc (10mg/ml). Feline post surgery pain.

conditions.name: Pain
conditions.notes: Given PRN for pain.

name: Buprenorphine SR (3mg/mL)
notes: DVM Rx Only! SQ only, lasts 3 days. Better than Tram/Tinic but expensive.

name: Rimadyl / Deramaxx
notes: DVM Rx Only! Do not use with other NSAIDs or steroids!

name: Metacam (Meloxicam)
notes: DVM Rx Only! Do not use with other NSAIDs or steroids! Can be used for high fevers in cats.

name: Gabapentin
notes: DVM Rx Only. Safe, good for cats and dogs.

name: Ivermectin 1%
notes: DO NOT USE ON HEARTWORM POSITIVE DOGS.

conditions.name: Roundworms / Mites
conditions.notes: Repeat in 2-3 weeks. Dosage based on 1% solution (10mg/ml). PDF lists 0.2-0.4mg/lb.

name: Benadryl
notes: Itching, allergies, vaccine reaction.

name: Famotidine
notes: Gastric ulcers, if on NSAID or steroid.

conditions.name: Diarrhea
conditions.notes: Give when diarrhea is seen.

conditions.name: Diarrhea
conditions.notes: Give when diarrhea is seen.

name: Metronidazole (Flagyl)
notes: Used for Giardia and IBD. Bitter taste.

conditions.name: Giardia / IBD
conditions.notes: Give with food.

conditions.name: BANNED
conditions.notes: BANNED IN FOOD ANIMALS. Do not administer.

conditions.name: Bacterial Infections
conditions.notes: PDF lists 2.5-5mg/lb, but standard Clavamox dose is often 6.25mg/lb (13.75mg/kg).

name: Doxycycline
notes: MUST be followed by water (syringe) or food to prevent esophageal strictures.

conditions.name: Bacterial / Mycoplasma / Chlamydia
conditions.notes: PDF lists 3mg/lb. Common range 2-5mg/lb.

conditions.name: Coccidiosis
conditions.notes: Double the first dose (25mg/lb), then 12.5mg/lb daily.

conditions.name: Pneumonia / Bacterial Infection
conditions.notes: Initial loading dose: 55 mg/kg (IV), then 27.5 mg/kg maintenance. Meat Withdrawal: 7 days. Milk Withdrawal: 60 hours.

name: Clindamycin (Antirobe)
notes: Good for dental infections/mouth.

name: Enrofloxacin (Baytril)
notes: WARNING: Retinal toxicity in cats. Do not overdose.

conditions.name: Bacterial Infections
conditions.notes: Do NOT exceed 2.3 mg/lb (5 mg/kg) daily.

conditions.name: Bacterial Infections
conditions.notes: Can be divided into two doses. Do not use in young dogs.

conditions.name: Respiratory Disease (BRD)
conditions.notes: Do NOT use in dairy production cattle or veal calves. Meat Withdrawal: 28 days. Single high dose alternative: 7.5-12.5 mg/kg once.

name: Prednisolone / Methylprednisolone
notes: Do not use with NSAIDs (Metacam).

name: Aspirin (Buffered/Baby)
notes: EXTREME CAUTION. Do not use Tylenol or Ibuprofen varieties. Stop if vomiting/diarrhea occurs.

conditions.name: Pain
conditions.notes: ONLY Baby Aspirin (81mg). ONE pill per 15 lbs every 48 hours. Toxic if given more frequently.

conditions.name: Pain
conditions.notes: 1 Baby Aspirin (81mg) per 15 lbs OR 1 Adult Aspirin (325mg) per 60 lbs.

name: Tylenol (Acetaminophen)
notes: FATAL TO CATS. Use with caution in dogs; liver toxicity risk.

conditions.name: Pain / Fever
conditions.notes: Based on PDF: 1 Regular Strength (325mg) per 55 lbs. Do NOT give to cats.

conditions.name: Joint Support
conditions.notes: Double dose for first 2-4 weeks.

conditions.name: Joint Support
conditions.notes: Double dose for first 2-4 weeks.

name: Claritin (Loratadine)
notes: Do NOT use 'Claritin-D' (contains decongestant which is toxic).

conditions.name: Allergies
conditions.notes: Small dogs: 5mg (1/2 tab). Large dogs: 10mg (1 tab).

name: Chlor-Trimeton (Chlorpheniramine)
notes: Used for itching and hives.

conditions.name: Itching / Hives
conditions.notes: 1/2 of a 4mg tablet.

conditions.name: Itching / Hives
conditions.notes: 1 tablet (4mg) per 8-16 lbs.

name: Pepto-Bismol / Kaopectate
notes: Contains Salicylates. TOXIC TO CATS if overdosed. Use with caution.

conditions.name: Diarrhea
conditions.notes: 1 ml per 2 lbs OR 1 tsp per 10 lbs.

name: Immodium AD (Loperamide)
notes: Do NOT use in Collies/Shepherds (MDR1 gene). Constipation risk.

conditions.name: Diarrhea
conditions.notes: Approx 1 caplet (2mg) per 44 lbs.

conditions.name: Motion Sickness
conditions.notes: Approx 1 tablet (50mg) per 25 lbs (PDF says 1 per 14-28 lbs).

name: Marbofloxacin (Zeniquin)
notes: Fluoroquinolone. Do not use in young animals (cartilage issues).

conditions.name: Bacterial Infections
conditions.notes: 2.75 - 5.5 mg/kg once daily.

conditions.name: Bacterial Infections
conditions.notes: 2.75 - 5.5 mg/kg once daily.

name: Pradofloxacin (Veraflox)
notes: Bone marrow suppression risk in dogs (not labeled for dogs in US).

conditions.name: Bacterial Infections
conditions.notes: Do not use in kittens under 12 months.

name: Robenacoxib (Onsior)
notes: Short-term use in cats (up to 3 days).

conditions.name: Pain / Inflammation
conditions.notes: Round up to nearest whole tablet.

conditions.name: Pain / Inflammation
conditions.notes: Max 3 days.

name: Mirtazapine Transdermal (Mirataz)
notes: Wear gloves. Rotate ears.

conditions.name: Weight Loss / Appetite
conditions.notes: Apply 1.5-inch ribbon to inner pinna.

conditions.name: Inappetence
conditions.notes: Range 1-3 mg/kg.

conditions.name: Inappetence
conditions.notes: Labeled for 4 days.

name: Pimobendan (Vetmedin)
notes: Contraindicated in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM).

conditions.name: Congestive Heart Failure
conditions.notes: Typical dose per cat is 1.25 mg.

conditions.name: Congestive Heart Failure
conditions.notes: 0.3 mg/kg TID is alternative dose.

name: Oclacitinib (Apoquel)
notes: Do not use in dogs < 12 months or with serious infections.

conditions.name: Atopic Dermatitis / Itch
conditions.notes: Start BID for 14 days, then maintenance SID.

name: Cisapride
notes: Contraindicated in GI obstruction.

conditions.name: Megacolon / Constipation
conditions.notes: Dose is per cat, not per weight.

conditions.name: GI Stasis
conditions.notes: 0.5-1 mg/kg every 8 hours.

name: Sildenafil (Viagra)
notes: Improves energy/quality of life in heart/lung patients.

name: Enalapril
notes: ACE Inhibitor. Do not use in pregnant pets. FDA approved for dogs, commonly used in cats.

name: Levothyroxine (Thyro-Tabs)
notes: Monitor T4 levels. Overdose causes panting/thirst.

conditions.name: Hypothyroidism
conditions.notes: Dose is PER CAT, not per lb.

conditions.name: Hypothyroidism
conditions.notes: PDF lists 0.1 mg per 10 lbs.

name: Furosemide (Lasix)
notes: Ensure water is available. May cause sun sensitivity.

conditions.name: Fluid Retention / Edema
conditions.notes: Cats usually get the lower dose.

name: Cefpodoxime (Simplicef)
notes: Give with food to increase absorption.

name: Methocarbamol (Robaxin)
notes: May darken urine. Causes drowsiness.

conditions.name: Muscle Spasms / Tremors
conditions.notes: Loading dose day 1: 20-30 mg/lb. Maintenance: 10-30 mg/lb.

conditions.name: Muscle Spasms / Tremors
conditions.notes: Loading dose day 1: 20-30 mg/lb. Maintenance: 10-30 mg/lb.

name: Penicillin (Procaine / Pen G)
notes: Withdrawal times vary significantly by formulation (Procaine vs. Benathine). See specific withdrawal notes.

conditions.name: Infections (Abscess, Pneumonia, Sepsis)
conditions.notes: Procaine: 24k-66k units/kg IM q24h. Na/K Pen G: 20k units/kg IM/IV q6h. Meat Withdrawal: Procaine (10-21 days), Benathine (30 days).

name: Gentamicin (Injectable)
notes: WARNING: 18-month meat withdrawal. Nephrotoxicity risk.

conditions.name: Acute Infections
conditions.notes: Use with extreme caution. Meat Withdrawal: 18 months. Milk Withdrawal: 5 days.

name: Ceftiofur
notes: Generally safe. Sensitivity may occur.

conditions.name: Respiratory / Metritis / Foot Rot
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 3 days. Milk Withdrawal: 0 days.

name: TMS (Trimethoprim Sulfadiazine)
notes: Extralabel use in lactating dairy cattle is PROHIBITED. Oral dose not absorbed in ruminants.

name: Oxytetracycline
notes: Do not exceed 10ml per injection site. Give IV slowly. Renal necrosis at high doses.

conditions.name: Pneumonia / Sepsis (Standard)
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 18-22 days.

conditions.name: Pneumonia / Sepsis (Depot)
conditions.notes: Long acting formulation. Meat Withdrawal: 18-22 days.

name: Florphenicol
notes: Not for use in dairy cattle. Do not exceed 10ml per injection site.

conditions.name: Respiratory / Foot Rot / Pinkeye (IM)
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 28 days.

conditions.name: Respiratory / Foot Rot / Pinkeye (SubQ)
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 38 days.

name: Erythromycin
notes: Prohibited in lactating dairy cattle >20 months.

conditions.name: Metritis / Pneumonia / Foot Rot
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 6 days (Recommended wait 21 days).

name: Oxytetracycline (LA-200)
notes: Rx. High dose/long acting. Rapid IV can cause collapse.

conditions.name: Pneumonia / Pinkeye / Foot Rot
conditions.notes: 9 mg/lb. Max 10ml per site. Meat Withdrawal: 28 days. Milk Discard: 96 hours.

name: Chlortetracycline (Feed Grade)
notes: VFD Required. Illegal for growth promotion.

conditions.name: Anaplasmosis / Pneumonia Control
conditions.notes: Withdrawal varies by formulation (often 0 days for anaplasmosis control). Check VFD label.

name: Ceftiofur Crystalline Free Acid (Excede)
notes: Rx. Injection site technique is paramount; fatal if arterial.

conditions.name: BRD / Foot Rot / Acute Metritis
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 13 days. Milk Discard: 0 hours. Illegal to inject in neck/muscle.

conditions.name: Clinical Mastitis
conditions.notes: Repeat once in 24 hours. Meat Withdrawal: 2 days. Milk Discard: 72 hours.

name: Tulathromycin (Draxxin)
notes: Rx. Long half-life. Not for female dairy cattle >20 months.

conditions.name: BRD / Pinkeye / Foot Rot
conditions.notes: 2.5 mg/kg. Meat Withdrawal: 18 days.

name: Tylosin (Tylan)
notes: Rx. Not for use in lactating dairy cattle.

conditions.name: Pneumonia / Foot Rot / Metritis
conditions.notes: 10-12 mg/kg. Meat Withdrawal: 21 days.

name: Sulfamethazine (Sustain III)
notes: Rx. PROHIBITED in lactating dairy cattle (>20mo) and Veal.

conditions.name: Pneumonia / Scours
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 12 days.

name: Moxidectin (Cydectin)
notes: Lipophilic; persistent activity.

conditions.name: Internal/External Parasites (Pour-On)
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 0 days. Milk Withdrawal: 0 days.

conditions.name: Internal/External Parasites (Injectable)
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 21 days.

name: Eprinomectin (Eprinex / LongRange)
notes: LongRange is Rx only.

conditions.name: Parasites (Eprinex Pour-On)
conditions.notes: OTC. Meat/Milk Withdrawal: 0 days.

conditions.name: Parasites (LongRange Injectable)
conditions.notes: Rx. Meat Withdrawal: 48 days. Do NOT use in breeding bulls.

name: Fenbendazole (Safe-Guard)
notes: OTC. Safe for pregnant/lactating cows. Kills worms only (not lice).

conditions.name: Internal Parasites
conditions.notes: Dosage based on 10% suspension (2.3 mg/lb). Meat Withdrawal: 8 days.

name: Albendazole (Valbazen)
notes: OTC. TERATOGENIC: Do not use in first 45 days of pregnancy.

conditions.name: Liver Flukes / Parasites
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 27 days.

name: Amprolium (Corid)
notes: High doses/prolonged use can cause Thiamine deficiency (PEM).

conditions.name: Coccidiosis (Prevention)
conditions.notes: 8 oz of 9.6% solution per 100 gal water. Meat Withdrawal: 24 hours.

conditions.name: Coccidiosis (Treatment)
conditions.notes: 16 oz of 9.6% solution per 100 gal water. Meat Withdrawal: 24 hours.

name: Flunixin Meglumine (Banamine)
notes: Rx. Injectable is IV ONLY (IM causes necrosis).

conditions.name: Fever / Endotoxemia (Injectable)
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 4 days. Milk Withdrawal: 36 hours.

conditions.name: Fever / Pain (Transdermal)
conditions.notes: Meat Withdrawal: 8 days. Not for lactating dairy cows.

name: Dexamethasone
notes: Rx. ABORTION RISK: High risk in 3rd trimester.

conditions.name: Inflammation / Ketosis / Allergy
conditions.notes: Approx dose (0.08 mg/kg). Check concentration.

name: Prostaglandins (Lutalyse/Estrumate)
notes: Rx. CAUTION: Absorbed through skin. Risk to women/asthmatics.

conditions.name: Estrus Synch / Abortion
conditions.notes: Lutalyse dose: 5ml. Estrumate dose: 2ml.

name: Thiamine (500 mg/mL)
notes: Rx. Use high concentration (500mg/ml) for Polio.
